text: lamb shoulder is one of my favorite cuts
of meat to braise it's a wonderful
cold-weather dish because the oven does
most of the work and it feeds a crowd
start with a 5 pound piece of boneless
and butterflied lamb more salt than you
ever think it could take I promise and
lots of freshly ground black pepper and
of course we can't forget about the
other side the shoulder is an economical
piece of meat and it's marbled with lots
of fat and that fats gonna add flavor to
the dish and before we start searing
quarter cup of all-purpose flour it may
seem like a lot of flour but it really
does cook off you won't taste a trace of
flour when it's all done I assure you
and you could use a knife but I like to
use scissors here I find it quite easy
this piece of meat is too big for any
pan that I keep in my kitchen
so now we're ready to start cooking when
braising meat the very first step in
cooking is to sear the meat have a large
braising pan or straight-sided skillet
set over a medium-high heat preheated
nice and hot and in goes olive oil about
a tablespoon this is a lot of meat so
I'm doing this in two batches fat side
down first hear that sound that's
exactly what we're looking for and this
needs a few minutes per side just until
it's a nice golden brown color I think
this is about ready yeah beautiful
golden brown color a nice crust very
important when you're searing like this
do not touch the meat let it do its
thing in the pan if you move it around
it's not going to build that beautiful
crust you're gonna be missing out on
lots of flavor so we can take this out
and our second piece goes in fat side
down again okay this guy's ready to come
out and reduce the temperature to medium
in the pan and straight away you can
drop your onions in this is one large
onion that's been peeled and coarsely
chopped throw this around in the fat
draping up the bottom our onions are
softened picking up a little bit of
color the next step garlic six cloves
here that's about three tablespoons
peeled and minced two sprigs of rosemary
I always rub the rosemary
that support goes in the pot releases
those essential oils and two tablespoons
of tomato paste as always I like to
caramelize make a little space in the
pan drop that tomato paste in and just
stir it it will caramelize very quickly
only takes a minute or two next we have
our wet ingredients were stash your
sauce two tablespoons one bottle of
stout beer in honor of Saint Patty's Day
this is Guinness but you can use any
good stout and chicken broth low-sodium
if you're buying it in the can 1 and 3/4
cup let this come up to a simmer
scraping the bottom of the pan to make
sure you're lifting up all of that
flavor at this point you can crank the
heat up to high to make this happen more
quickly and you should also have your
oven preheated to 325 degrees
we've reached the boiling point time to
return the lamb back into the pan so get
some of those juices over the top of
that meat when you're braising you're
not fully submerged you're about
two-thirds of the way up the pan okay
it's back to a boil so we can turn it
off pop on a lid and this is going to go
into a preheated terrine 25 degree oven
until the meat is fork tender that's
going to take about two-and-a-half to
three hours and pop off the lid let it
cool to room temperature and put it in
the refrigerator for one to three days
allowing the lamb to hang out on the
fridge
offers a two-fold benefit first the fat
congeals at the top and it makes it very
easy to remove you can see I've done it
here lots of fat it also really improves
the flavor of the braise because all of
those wonderful braising liquids and the
meat get to hang out together and meld
I've reheated this over a medium flame
just until the meats warmed through that
takes about 15 minutes and then you can
use two forks and shred the meat into
bite-size pieces the smell is amazing I
cannot wait to eat this and I love to
serve this with roasted root vegetables
like carrots parsnips celery root
potatoes and of course we need some of
this beautiful velvety braising liquid
this is really wonderful with watercress
or
upland cress like this for peppery fresh
bite and my secret weapon for this dish
tomato jam you could also use your
favorite fruit chutney but it offers a
nice tart sweet contrast to this rich
decadent lamb dish braising is a
wonderful way to get maximum flavor with
minimal effort
happy eating
you
